title: A schema template for the systematic review frontalPNP
description: This is a proof of concept aimed to digitalize papers in table 2 of the paper by Van Petten and Luka (2012) Int. Jou. of Psychophy. 83, 176â€“190. In this review a number of ERPs papers on sentence processing are considered by looking at contrasts between higher- and lower-cloze congruent sentence completions.

paperid.title: paperid
paperid.description: The id of the annotated paper, should be [last author family name][year of publication][first page].

experiments.title: An array of Experiments
experiments.description: Papers typically contain multiple experiments, please add an element array for each experiment, information about how to split data into experiments are refereed in the manual.

expname.title: Name of the experiment
expname.description: A label of the form exp[N], where N is an integer. We suggest to keep the original paper number, otherwise add a filed "note on name".

content.title: Experiment description
content.description: A brief description of the experiment aims and possibly about its role within the aims of the specific secondary research that is currently pursued.

eeg.title: EEG Section
eeg.description: A collection of information about EEG recording and the analysis pipeline for ERPs extraction.

recording reference.title: Recording reference
recording reference.description: The EEG site used for reference electrode during recording (typical value are left/right/linked mastoids, average, Cz).

analysis reference.title: Analysis reference
analysis reference.description: Describe the analysis reference in the case a rereference was done otherwise leave this field blank.

sampling rate.title: Sampling rate
sampling rate.description: Samplig rate of the EEG recording in Hz (number of EEG measures per second).

final Low Pass.title: Final Low Pass filter
final Low Pass.description: The cutoff frequency in Hz of the more severe low pass filter applied to the data prior to the plot.

final High Pass.title: The final High Pass filter
final High Pass.description: The cutoff frequency in Hz of the more severe high pass filter applied to the data prior to the plot.

epoch rejection.title: Epoch rejection method
epoch rejection.description: A verbal description of the way the epoch rejection was performed: can be any of "manual", "automatic"or "semiautomatic" or it can be also a more in depth description including the specific parameters used in the procedure.

mean rejected.title: Mean rejected
mean rejected.description: The proportion of trials removed by the artifact rejection procedure (across different conditions), should be a number between 0 and 1.

sites nomenclature.title: Sites nomenclature
sites nomenclature.description: A description of the standard used to label the channel/sites. In case of non standard sites put "custom" and add a filed "note on sites" with the original description of the position of the electrodes should be provided.

sites.title: Recorded Sites
sites.description: An array of strings with the labels used in the paper figures of the recorded EEG sites/channels.

sites 5%.title: Sites 5%
sites 5%.description: In the case the paper does not use the standard nomenclature 5 per cent (or a subset of it like the 10-20) for each of the sites listed above the closest site in the 5 per cent standard should be provided. Otherwise leave this array empty.

baseline.title: Baseline
baseline.description: The interval used for the baseline of the ERPs with reference to the onset of the critical word. It should in the form "MIN, MAX" in ms. In the case different baselines are used for different conditions or target words please add a field "note on baseline".

epoch.title: Epoch inteval
epoch.description: The epochs used of the ERPs extraction (may be larger than the plotted ones, time range plotted is reported in the data section) with reference to the onset of the critical word. It should in the form "MIN, MAX" in ms. In the case different epochs are used for different conditions or target words please add a field "note on epoch".

hardware.title: Hardware
hardware.description: A description of the EEG system used (recording device and optionally recording software).

subjects.title: Subject Groups Section
subjects.description: An array with information about the groups of subjects tested.

items.title: A group of subjects
items.description: A collection of relevant information about a single group of subjects.

groupname.title: A label for this group
groupname.description: A short and possibly informative label of the group of subjects

n.title: Number of subjects
n.description: An integer: the number of subject included in the final analysis. Put -1 if the information is not provided. If different subjects were used for different conditions or target words please add a field "note on n"

mean age.title: Mean age
mean age.description: Mean age of this group of subject in years. Put -1 if not provided.

age range.title: Age range
age range.description: Age range in the form "MIN, MAX" in years, leave empty if not provided.

num of females.title: Number of females
num of females.description: The number of females in the sample,  put -1 if the information is not provided.

language(s) spoken.title: Language(s) spoken
language(s) spoken.description: First language of the subjects and possible information about further other language known, when provided.

description.title: Group Descrirption
description.description: Report other information reported about the group (e.g. about vision, hearing capability, cognitive and neurological state).

procedure.title: Experimental Procedure Section
procedure.description: A collection of information about the experimental procedure, including stimuli and behavioural tasks.

language.title: Language of the stimuli
language.description: The language of the sentences or words presented to subjects during the experiment.

modality.title: Presentation modality
modality.description: Modality of presentation of the stimuli, may be "auditory",  "visual" or "unknown".

task.title: Requested task
task.description: The behavioral task which subjects were requested to perform, typical values are: "silent reading", "reading for comprhension", "comprehension questions", "word monitoring".

lists.title: Lists
lists.description: A textual description of the type of counterbalancement of material across participants (e.g. latin squar design), number of different lists can also be reported.

word duration.title: Word duration
word duration.description: The time in ms for which the words were presented. In case the duration was variable a textual description of duration estimates (e.g. mean minimum, maximum) can  be provided.

woa.title: Word Onset Asyncrony
woa.description: The time in ms that occured between the onset of a word and the onset of t0he following word (e.g. word duration plus interstimulus interval).

conditions.title: Experimental Conditions
conditions.description: An array with information about the tested experimental conditions.

items.title: An Experimental Condition
items.description: A collection of informations about a specific experimental condition.

condname.title: Condition label
condname.description: A short and possibly informative label of the experimental condition.

cp.title: Cloze Probability
cp.description: The average cloze probability of the items in this condition, if available. In case an upper bound of the cloze probability is provided put this with a trailing minor sign (e.g. "<0.05"). A "note on cp" field can be added to give more information about how cp was estimated (e.g. number of participants in the pre-test) and possible measures of cp variability across items.

items.title: Number of items
items.description: The numeber of items (words/sentences) which was presented in this condition to each subject. If it is variable add a "note on items" field.

description.title: Condition description
description.description: A textual description of this experimental condition.

example.title: Sentence example
example.description: If available provide an example of the sentence used in this experiment and condition by placing the target word  between asteriscs (e.g. "He spread the butter with a *sock*").

wp.title: Word Position
wp.description: A description of the word position in the sentence at which the ERPs were measured (e.g. "target", "post target", "end of sentence".

data.title: Data section
data.description: An array of entries corresponding to plotted waveforms with information about where these can be found.

items.title: Waveforms
items.description: Information relative to a group of waveforms pertaining to a pool of sites/channel but to a signle condition and group of subjects. Sites will be a subset of the above field in the eeg section, otherwise add a field "note on sites"

condition.title: Condition label
condition.description: An condition label instantiated above in the procedure section.

subjects.title: Group label
subjects.description: An subject-group label instantiated above in the subjects section.

time.title: Time Range
time.description: The (maximum) time range of the plotted data,  should be in the form "MIN, MAX".

figure.title: Figure label
figure.description: A short label for the  figure from which the specific waveform should be extracted. Should be in the form "fig[N][A]", where N  in an integer and A an optional letter (e.g. "fig1A").  This label should match both the description in the paper and the name of the image file to be used for the digitalization (e.g "fig1A.png".

figuredoi.title: Figure doi
figuredoi.description: A doi for the specific figure,  if available.

page.title: Page number
page.description: The number of the page in which the figure appears.

color.title: Line color
color.description: A verbal description of the color in which the waveform appears in the plot.

type.title: Line  type
type.description: A verbal description of the graphic type of the line (e.g. continuous, dashed, dotted ...).
